metadata.name: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\reg.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('reg.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('software\\\\microsoft\\\\windows defender\\\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('software\\\\policies\\\\microsoft\\\\windows defender security center')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('software\\\\policies\\\\microsoft\\\\windows defender\\\\'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' add ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('d 0')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disallowexploitprotectionoverride')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('enablecontrolledfolderaccess')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('mpenablepus')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('puaprotection')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('spynetreporting')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('submitsamplesconsent')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tamperprotection'))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' add ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('d 1')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableantispyware')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableantispywarerealtimeprotection')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableantivirus')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disablearchivescanning')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disablebehaviormonitoring')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableblockatfirstseen')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableconfig')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableenhancednotifications')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableintrusionpreventionsystem')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableioavprotection')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableonaccessprotection')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableprivacymode')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disablerealtimemonitoring')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disableroutinelytakingaction')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disablescanonrealtimeenable')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disablescriptscanning')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('notification_suppress')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('signaturedisableupdateonstartupwithoutengine')))))

output.summary: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection

metadata.objective: False positive: Rare legitimate use by administrators to test software (should always be investigated) References: https://thedfirreport.com/2022/03/21/apt35-automates-initial-access-using-proxyshell/, https://github.com/swagkarna/Defeat-Defender-V1.2.0, https://www.elevenforum.com/t/video-guide-how-to-completely-disable-microsoft-defender-antivirus.14608/page-2
